reviews.review: I love this game so much. Been playing for years my xbox and never stopped playing. Finally switched to Pc

Personaly, I like this game a lot. I've played it since it's early days of development and, oh boy, let me tell you about "Those Days".
of course you're not here to listen to a story about where it began, you wanna know if it's worth the price tag, yea? Well for me it's a resounding yes, and heres why.

I have an affinity for the horror genre, and this game hits all the buttons you'd want in a pvp horror game and more. With suspenseful gameplay, adrenaline stirring action and mechanics based heavily in solo and team oriented gameplay, I generaly find myself loving every second [save for face campers] of sneaking my way around trees and corners, doing my best to keep the killer guessing where I am.

but let's say this doesn't sound like you, you're not a horror genre vet, you scare pretty easily, maybe you're new to gaming all together and a friend is trying to start you off with this one...
Well then, let's talk about mechanics, and what to expect!

Starting out: I would recommend you start as a survivor, in each match you will be one of 4 survivors doing your best to avoid a killer {enemy player} and repair generators to assure your escape. Think of Hide&Seek, but with a murderer. Using the terrain to your advantage and help from other players, you're team will be focused on repairing up to 5 generators before opening the gates to achieve sweet a escape.

Mechanics: Oh boy does this game have them, from skill checks that require you to keep your focus on the game at all times while preforming most actions, to a wide collection of tools and items this game has you covered when it comes to varried play styles. Using different combinations of perks and items, you could play quiet and stealthy, popping one gen after the other while avoiding detection, OR you could take the loud approach, skillfuly weaving between pallets and hopping through windows, making the killers head spin till they're stomping after you with bloody vengence on the mind, giving your team the opening they need to get those gens up and running!

Now, all this sounds well and good doesn't it, but I hear you say "What about the killers? I wanna maim and scare the **** out of people!" Fret not, this game has you covered there too!

The Killers: Oh the killers, talking about varried play styles, the killers bring them in spades! While yes a number of killers are locked behind a paywall, the ones that are available offer just as much fun to their kits!
From the wraith that can trudge around the map as invisable as he pleases, to the trapper who can catch players unaware in his bear traps, the Nurse who can blink around the map like a frog on a mission and many more, the ever expanding cast of killers and their wide varriety of unlockable perks can turn almost any killers playstyle into a deadly weapon.

Perks: Oh, what's this? You thought the perks were character specific? Well, I'm glad to inform you, while you may need to play a character up to a certain point, or watch the shrine in the shop for their perk to drop, once a perk has been unlocked it is available to all survivors {Siilarly all perks can be shared between killers} Allowing you to pick your favorite character and play a game of mix and match with the wide variety of perks available to the groups. Wanna be a medic? Claudetes got you. You sneaky and stealthy? Nea is right up your alley. Maybe you like giving your allies a buff! Dweight is always right. With the colorful selection of perks available, finding a play style that works for you is as easy as slotting them in, grabbing that toolbox and going to work.

Oh hey, you reached the end of my review! Thanks for reading through, do remember of course that this should all be taken with a few grains of salt as most of this is my personal opinion after an extensive amount of time with this game. If this type of game isnt for you, that's perfectly fine, not everyone has to enjoy every game ever made, just stick to what you enjoy and have fun!

It feels like the devs just try to make every new killer be stronger and have more broken perks than the last. P.S. Why is iron maiden not a hex, it almost completely removes a feature of the game.

Dzieńdobry
Pozdrawiam słuchaczy piszę tą rozprawkę żeby napisac o tym jak mozna byc patrotą zarówno w czasie wojny jak i pokoju. Ja to pisze bo to rozprawka podam argumentacje i pokaże wa jak można byc patriotą. Pisanie rozprawki to nie łatwa rzecz musicie uszanowac argumenty, to teraz pisze argumenty i czemu tak jest.
Z byciem patriotą jest trudno trzeba się starać, tak jak różne postacie w literautzre którą są patriotami i w literaturze i w prawdziwym życie, są patriotami w czasie wojny i pokoju. Nie jest łatwo być patriota tak jak JÓzef Piłsudzki który pomógł polsce w czasie wojny i pokoju pomagał polsce walczyc z innymi krajami i jest patriota bo pomółgł polsce w czasie wojny i pokoju. On jest patriotą i bycie jak on jest trudne, nie jest łatwe ale trzeba być w czasie pokoju i wojny. Jak widzicie są postacie w literaturze i sztuce że mozna byc patriotą w czasie wojny i pokoju jak Józef Piłsudzki, tak samo zrobił postać Jezus w Biblii. Jezus jest patriotą świata jest patriotom w czasie pokoju i w czasie wojn y z grzechem. Mówił żeby się miłowac bo jest patriotą i chce pokój dla świata i jak widac Jezus tez jest patriotą i warto za nim podąrzać w literaturze pokoju wojnie i innym. Tak samo patriotom są osoba w otoczeniu nauczyciele i inni dyrektor godło wywiesza w klasie. Jak widać jest dużo patriotów w literaturze, historii, własnej obserwacji.
Jak widać bycie patriotą jest trudno i można to robić rózne sposoby w literaturze i sztuce.

Alright so....

This game has its problems like all games. Mostly, you'll notice some bugs and lack of balance... 

BUT...

It will always hold a special place in my heart. The devs work hard even though they sometimes don't get things done the most effective way, but you can tell they love the game as well. The things they have planned will make the game even better.
